thread.title: Manchester United's Zlatan Ibrahimovic maintains THAT elbow on Tyrone Mings was an accident as violent-conduct ban looms
thread.title_full: Manchester United's Zlatan Ibrahimovic maintains THAT elbow on Tyrone Mings was an accident as violent-conduct ban looms

author: David McDonnell
title: Manchester United's Zlatan Ibrahimovic maintains THAT elbow on Tyrone Mings was an accident as violent-conduct ban looms
text:
Zlatan's elbow found Mings' head (left) shortly after the defender's boot had met his (right) (Photo: Getty Images) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Zlatan Ibrahimovic claims he is innocent of swinging a vicious elbow – but is still facing a three-match ban for violent conduct. 
Ibrahimovic caught Tyrone Mings in the head with his arm during Manchester United ’s fractious 1-1 draw with Bournemouth at Old Trafford on Saturday. 
Defender Mings had earlier trodden on the Swedish striker's head as he lay on the pitch, and is also facing retrospective action and a three-match ban. 
The FA are set to charge the pair, with Ibrahimovic seeming to acknowledge as much when asked if he feared trial by video. 
“I respect every decision,” said the 35-year-old. “But I’m not here to attack anybody. My purpose was not to do that. The game is hard. 
"I can talk about my situation. I jumped straight up, he jumps in for me. Ibrahimovic is adamant there was no malice in this clash with Mings... (Photo: REUTERS) ....which leaves the Swede sweating on a three-match suspension (Photo: REUTERS) 
“I jump very high and protect myself at the same time as I always do, and go for the ball. He jumps into me and jumps into my elbow — nothing on purpose and hopefully he’s not injured. 
“It had nothing to do with the situation before because I didn’t even know who had stepped on me. It’s the game. I’m not a player who will stand here and blame a player. What happens on the field stays on the field.” 
For his part, Mings insisted neither player deserves to be hit with a violent conduct charge. 
“It was a good battle,” said the 23-year-old. “I haven’t seen it back, but you know exactly what you’re going to get against him. He’s a big physical player and if he says he didn’t mean it [the elbow], then he didn’t mean it. That’s fine. 
“I jumped over someone else, I think, and then if I caught him, I caught him. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
